Name: AmigaOS classic
Creator: Commodore International, Haage & Partner, Hyperion Entertainment
Predecessor: TRIPOS (as the disk operating component of AmigaOS)
Cost, availability: Discontinued; Bundled with hardware up to version 3.0 (Amiga International hardware came with 3.1); versions 2.1, 3.0, 3.1, 3.5, 3.9 also available as separate packages
Preferred license: Proprietary, open source clone available under AROS Public License

Name: AmigaOS 4
Creator: Hyperion Entertainment
Cost, availability: 4.0 bundled with hardware; 4.0 for classic and 4.1 available as standalone package at €29

Name: eComStation
Creator: Serenity Systems, Mensys BV
Cost, availability:
Home-student edition (max. five per site) US$149.00
business edition $259.00

Name: Inferno
Creator: Bell Labs
Preferred license: MIT, GNU GPL, GNU LGPL, LPL

Name: iOS
Creator: Apple Inc.
Cost, availability: Bundled with hardware and free updates given to most existing users, subject to hardware requirements
Preferred license: Proprietary higher level API layers; open source core system (ARM versions): APSL, GNU GPL, others

Name: Mac OS
Creator: Apple Inc.
Cost, availability:
Discontinued; Was bundled with 68k and PowerPC Macs;
versions 7-9 sold as retail upgrades

Name: (Mac) OS X
Creator: Apple Inc.
Cost, availability: Bundled with hardware; No-cost update via Mac App Store for users of OS X 10.6 or later, assuming hardware requirements are met
Preferred license: Proprietary higher level API layers; open source core system (Intel-PowerPC versions): APSL, GNU GPL, others

Name: (Mac) OS X Server
Creator: Apple Inc.
Cost, availability: Previously bundled with hardware; No longer a separate operating system, but a group of services installed atop any current version of Mac OS X; US$19.99 on the Mac App Store
Preferred license: Proprietary higher level API layers; open source core system (Intel-PowerPC versions): APSL, GNU GPL, others

Name: MPE
Creator: HP
Cost, availability: Discontinued; Was bundled with HP-3000 CISC hardware "Classic"

Name: MPE/XL
Creator: HP
Cost, availability: Discontinued; Was bundled with HP-3000 PA-RISC hardware

Name: NetWare
Creator: Novell
Cost, availability: Superseded by Novell Open Enterprise Server; Was US$184 (one-user)

Name: NeXTSTEP
Creator: NeXT
Cost, availability: Discontinued; Was bundled with hardware, then sold separately

Name: OpenIndiana
Creator: Many, based on software developed by Sun Microsystems and many others

Name: QNX
Creator: QNX Software Systems
Cost, availability: Bundled with BlackBerry 10 and PlayBook devices. Commercial; an academic version exists that needs authorization code before installing
Target system type: Automotive, medical, smartphones, consumer, industrial, embedded, safety

Name: Solaris
Creator: Sun
Cost, availability: Commercial; (but free/no-cost perpetual license when used "for the purpose of developing, testing, prototyping and demonstrating your applications")

Name: Windows Server (NT family)
Creator: Microsoft
Cost, availability: US$469 Web Server; other editions dependent on number of CALs purchased

Name: Windows (NT family)
Creator: Microsoft
Target system type: Workstation, personal computer, media center, Tablet PC, embedded

Name: RISC OS
Creator: Acorn Computers
Predecessor: Arthur, also the BBC Master OS

Name: RISC OS
Creator: RISCOS Ltd, Pace plc
Cost, availability: Bundled with hardware, then sold separately at £70 (US$127)

Name: RISC OS
Creator: Castle Technology, RISC OS Open
Cost, availability: Free for non-commercial use (recent releases); formerly bundled with hardware

Name: RISC OS
Creator: RISCOS Ltd
Cost, availability: Bundled with hardware, then sold separately at £70 (US$127)

Name: STOP 6, XTS-400
Creator: BAE Systems
Cost, availability: US$60k+; bundled with XTS hardware and OEM licensed

Name: z/OS
Creator: IBM
Cost, availability: Monthly license fee, about US$130 and up
